data.title: The Liturgical Identity of the Syro-Malabar Church and Fidelity to the Patrimony of the Eastern Churches
data.abstractNote: In this article, the liturgical identity of the Syro-Malabar Church and its fidelity to the heritage of the Eastern Churches are illustrated based on three important liturgical books: the Pontifical, the Order of the Holy Qurbana and the Ritual of the Sacramental Liturgy. The article shows that after a long period of liturgical syncretism, Westernization, and inauthentic manipulations, the Syro-Malabar Church restored its Eastern and East Syriac liturgical identity over the course of a century (1923-2023) through a gradual and painful process of restoration and reform under the paternal care of the Roman Pontiffs and the accompanying guidance of the Congregation for the Eastern Churches.
